item.title: Urgent Care Services For Cancer Patients Offer A Gentler ER Alternative
item.description: May 3, 2017 - Some hospitals and oncology practices are setting up urgent care sites tailored to the needs of cancer patients, to help keep them out of the emergency room when complications or side effects arise.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 3, 2017 - Some hospitals and oncology practices are setting up urgent care sites tailored to the needs of cancer patients, to help keep them out of the emergency room when complications or side effects arise. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/03/526594004/urgent-care-services-for-cancer-patients-offer-a-gentler-er-alternative

item.title: Microscopic Cars Square Off In Big Race
item.description: May 2, 2017 - This car race involved years of training, feats of engineering, high-profile sponsorships, competitors from around the world and a racetrack made of gold. And it's invisible to the naked eye.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 2, 2017 - This car race involved years of training, feats of engineering, high-profile sponsorships, competitors from around the world and a racetrack made of gold. And it's invisible to the naked eye. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/05/02/526605120/microscopic-cars-square-off-in-big-race

item.title: Why Social Media Isn't Always Very Social
item.description: May 2, 2017 - Studies show that people who spend more time on social media sites feel more socially isolated than those who don't. This might be because of a disconnect between our online lives and our real ones.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 2, 2017 - Studies show that people who spend more time on social media sites feel more socially isolated than those who don't. This might be because of a disconnect between our online lives and our real ones. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/02/526514168/why-social-media-isnt-always-very-social

item.title: A New Generation Overthrows Gender
item.description: May 2, 2017 - Parents, schools and elected officials are working to catch up and adapt to the needs of children and teens who don't fit into familiar gender categories.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 2, 2017 - Parents, schools and elected officials are working to catch up and adapt to the needs of children and teens who don't fit into familiar gender categories. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/02/526067768/a-new-generation-overthrows-gender

item.title: Environmentalists, Coal Companies Rally Around Technology To Clean Up Coal
item.description: May 1, 2017 - The industry has been in decline for years, partly because burning coal creates CO2 and warms the atmosphere. But there's a way to capture it — which has drawn praise from traditional enemies.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 1, 2017 - The industry has been in decline for years, partly because burning coal creates CO2 and warms the atmosphere. But there's a way to capture it — which has drawn praise from traditional enemies. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/05/01/524764617/environmentalists-coal-companies-rally-around-technology-to-clean-up-coal

item.title: A Lazarus Patient And The Limits Of A Lifesaving Stroke Procedure
item.description: May 1, 2017 - About 800,000 people have strokes each year in the U.S. Most are caused by clots that block blood to the brain. In some cases, doctors can remove the clot using a device that looks like a fishing net.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 1, 2017 - About 800,000 people have strokes each year in the U.S. Most are caused by clots that block blood to the brain. In some cases, doctors can remove the clot using a device that looks like a fishing net. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/01/525896731/a-lazarus-patient-and-the-limits-of-a-lifesaving-stroke-procedure

item.title: Yo-Yo Dieting May Pose Serious Risks For Heart Patients
item.description: May 1, 2017 - People with heart disease should keep their weight down, but it can be hard to lose weight and keep it off. Now a study shows big fluctuations may increase the risk of heart attack and stroke.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 1, 2017 - People with heart disease should keep their weight down, but it can be hard to lose weight and keep it off. Now a study shows big fluctuations may increase the risk of heart attack and stroke. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/01/526048767/-yo-yo-dieting-poses-serious-risks-for-heart-patients

item.title: Saturn: Cassini's Final Chapter
item.description: April 30, 2017 - After years, NASA's Cassini spacecraft will soon begin its final act — a plunge into Saturn. NPR's Lulu Garcia-Navarro talks to Dr. Carolyn Porco, head of the imaging team, about the mission's legacy.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 30, 2017 - After years, NASA's Cassini spacecraft will soon begin its final act — a plunge into Saturn. NPR's Lulu Garcia-Navarro talks to Dr. Carolyn Porco, head of the imaging team, about the mission's legacy. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/30/526250837/saturn-cassinis-final-chapter

item.title: Alaska Guessing Game Provides Climate Change Record
item.description: April 30, 2017 - Months behind the rest of the country, spring is advancing across Alaska. And a contest that has residents guess the date of river ice breakup is showing a trend toward earlier and earlier melt.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 30, 2017 - Months behind the rest of the country, spring is advancing across Alaska. And a contest that has residents guess the date of river ice breakup is showing a trend toward earlier and earlier melt. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/30/526021209/alaska-guessing-game-provides-climate-change-record

item.title: Being A Guinea Pig For Science Can Be A Long, Slow Slog
item.description: April 30, 2017 - Brandie Jefferson volunteered for a clinical trial to see if intermittent fasting can help treat multiple sclerosis. Five months in, she realizes that this study won't answer that question.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 30, 2017 - Brandie Jefferson volunteered for a clinical trial to see if intermittent fasting can help treat multiple sclerosis. Five months in, she realizes that this study won't answer that question. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/30/526047449/being-a-guinea-pig-for-science-can-be-a-long-slow-slog

item.title: Marchers Unite To Take On Trump's Climate Policies
item.description: April 29, 2017 - On the symbolic 100th day in office for President Trump, who has denied climate change, protesters are rallying in front of the White House to call for better environmental protections.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 29, 2017 - On the symbolic 100th day in office for President Trump, who has denied climate change, protesters are rallying in front of the White House to call for better environmental protections. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/29/526179637/thousands-of-marchers-expected-to-take-on-trumps-climate-policies

item.title: Florida Battles With Tricky Removal Of Costly Muck In Indian River Lagoon
item.description: April 27, 2017 - In Florida, an effort is underway to remove more than million cubic feet of muck sullying the Indian River Lagoon, considered North America's most biologically diverse estuary. It's a mess.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 27, 2017 - In Florida, an effort is underway to remove more than million cubic feet of muck sullying the Indian River Lagoon, considered North America's most biologically diverse estuary. It's a mess. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/27/525918318/florida-battles-with-tricky-removal-of-costly-muck-in-indian-river-lagoon

item.title: California Is On Its Way To Having An Avocado Crop Year-Round
item.description: April 27, 2017 - Americans ate 2 billion pounds of avocados last year; many came from Mexico. That's because avocados grow year-round in Mexico's climate, but not California's. Researchers are working to change that.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 27, 2017 - Americans ate 2 billion pounds of avocados last year; many came from Mexico. That's because avocados grow year-round in Mexico's climate, but not California's. Researchers are working to change that. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/04/27/525737123/california-is-on-its-way-to-having-an-avocado-crop-year-round

item.title: Scientists Hunt Hard Evidence On How Cop Cameras Affect Behavior
item.description: April 27, 2017 - Police departments in about 95 percent of cities nationally have put wearable cameras on officers, or soon plan to. But do these body cameras make neighborhoods safer? Scientists want to find out.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 27, 2017 - Police departments in about 95 percent of cities nationally have put wearable cameras on officers, or soon plan to. But do these body cameras make neighborhoods safer? Scientists want to find out. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/04/27/525081998/scientists-hunt-hard-evidence-on-how-cop-cameras-affect-behavior

item.title: Cassini Craft Beams Closest Images Ever Taken Of Saturn
item.description: April 27, 2017 - The spacecraft is "showing us new wonders and demonstrating where our curiosity can take us if we dare," NASA's planetary science director says.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 27, 2017 - The spacecraft is "showing us new wonders and demonstrating where our curiosity can take us if we dare," NASA's planetary science director says. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/27/525855868/cassini-craft-beams-closest-images-ever-taken-of-saturn
